meta-tag-type.name: Server Type

service.name: WSO2 Enterprise Service Bus_New
service.description:
The WSO2 ESB is a lightweight and easy-to-use Open Source Enterprise Service Bus (ESB) available under the Apache Software License v2.0. WSO2 ESB allows administrators to simply and easily configure message routing, virtualization, intermediation, transformation, logging, task scheduling, load balancing, failover routing, event brokering, etc.. The runtime has been designed to be completely asynchronous, non-blocking and streaming based on the Apache Synapse core.
WSO2 ESB is developed on top of the revolutionary Carbon platform (Middleware a' la carte), and is based on the OSGi framework to achieve the better modularity for your Service Oriented Architecture (SOA). This also contains a lots of new features and many other optional components to customize the behavior of the server.

owner-group.name: Default
owner-group.description: The Default vCloud Application Director group.

ns9:component-version-script.script:
################################################################################################# # PURPOSE: This script is used to install the WSO2 ESB on the linux machine # #################################################################################################
#!/bin/bash
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# IMPORT GLOBAL CONFIGURATION DATA FROM APPLICATIONDIRECTOR . $global_conf
########################## INTERNAL FUNCTIONS REGION ################################## # VALIDATION FUNCTIONS -- START
# FUNCTION TO CHECK ERROR function check_error() { if [ ! "$?" = "0" ]; then error_exit "$1"; fi }
# FUNCTION TO DISPLAY ERROR AND EXIT function error_exit() { echo "${PROGNAME}: ${1:-"Unknown Error"}" 1>&2 exit 1 } # VALIDATION FUNCTIONS -- END
########################## INTERNAL PARAMETERS REGION ################################## # INTERNAL PARAMETERS -- START WSO2_ESB_DOWNLOAD_URL="$wso2_esb_download_url" ANT_DOWNLOAD_URL="$ant_download_url" INSTALL_DIR="$install_dir" # INTERNAL PARAMETERS -- END
########################## SCRIPT EXECUTION REGION ################################## # SCRIPT EXECUTION -- END
#PARAMETER VALIDATION -- START echo "PARAMTER VALIDATION -- START" if [ "x${WSO2_ESB_DOWNLOAD_URL}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "WSO2 ESB DOWNLOAD URL NOT SET." fi
if [ "x${ANT_DOWNLOAD_URL}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "ANT DOWNLOAD URL NOT SET." fi
if [ "x${INSTALL_DIR}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "INSTALL DIR NOT SET." fi echo "PARAMTER VALIDATION -- DONE" #PARAMETER VALIDATION -- END
# INSTALLING WSO2 echo "INSTALLING PRE-REQUISTES..." if [ -f /etc/redhat-release ] ; then echo "RHEL / CENTOS OS" yum --nogpgcheck -y install unzip check_error "ERROR WHILE INSTALLING PRE-REQUISTES" elif [ -f /etc/debian_version ] ; then echo "Ubuntu OS" apt-get -f -y install linux-firmware --fix-missing apt-get -f -y install unzip check_error "ERROR WHILE INSTALLING PRE-REQUISTES" elif [ -f /etc/SuSE-release ] ; then echo "SUSE OS" zypper --non-interactive --no-gpg-checks install unzip check_error "ERROR WHILE INSTALLING PRE-REQUISTES" fi
mkdir $INSTALL_DIR cd $INSTALL_DIR
# DOWNLOADING WSO2 ESB INSTALLER ZIP FILE echo "DOWNLOADING WSO2 ESB INSTALLER ZIP FILE..." wget --output-document=installer.zip $WSO2_ESB_DOWNLOAD_URL check_error "ERROR WHILE DOWNLOADING WSO2 ESB INSTALLER ZIP FILE" echo "DOWNLOADING WSO2 ESB INSTALLER ZIP FILE -- DONE"
# UNZIP THE WSO2 ESB ZIP INSTALLER echo "UNZIPING THE WSO2 ESB ZIP INSTALLER..." unzip installer.zip check_error "ERROR WHILE UNZIPING THE WSO2 ESB ZIP INSTALLER" echo "UNZIPING THE WSO2 ESB ZIP INSTALLER -- DONE" # REMOVE THE INSTALLER TO SAVE THE DISK SPACE rm -rf installer.zip # RENAME THE EXTRACTED FOLDER NAME mv `find . -name 'wso*' -type d` wso2esb # SCRIPT EXECUTION -- END

meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

ns9:component-version-script.script:
################################################################################################# # PURPOSE: This script is used to Start the WSO2 ESB on the linux machine # # To compile and run the sample clients, an Ant version is required. # # Ant 1.7.0 version is recommended. # # To build the xml file using ant JDK is required. # #################################################################################################
#!/bin/bash
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# IMPORT GLOBAL CONFIGURATION DATA FROM APPLICATIONDIRECTOR . $global_conf
########################## INTERNAL FUNCTIONS REGION ################################## # VALIDATION FUNCTIONS -- START
# FUNCTION TO CHECK ERROR function check_error() { if [ ! "$?" = "0" ]; then error_exit "$1"; fi }
# FUNCTION TO DISPLAY ERROR AND EXIT function error_exit() { echo "${PROGNAME}: ${1:-"Unknown Error"}" 1>&2 exit 1 } # VALIDATION FUNCTIONS -- END
########################## INTERNAL PARAMETERS REGION ################################## # INTERNAL PARAMETERS -- START WSO2_ESB_DOWNLOAD_URL="$wso2_esb_download_url" ANT_DOWNLOAD_URL="$ant_download_url" INSTALL_DIR="$install_dir" # INTERNAL PARAMETERS -- END
########################## SCRIPT EXECUTION REGION ################################## # SCRIPT EXECUTION -- START
# NEED JDK TO BUILD THE WSO2 ESB XML FILE USING ant COMMAND echo "INSTALLING JDK..." yum -y install java-1.6.0-openjdk-devel check_error "ERROR WHILE INSTALLING JDK" echo "JDK INSTALLED SUCCESSFULLY!" update-alternatives --auto java
# DOWNLOAD ANT TO COMPILE AND RUN THE SAMPLE CLIENTS cd /usr echo "DOWNLOADING APACHE ANT..." wget --output-document=ant.tar.gz $ANT_DOWNLOAD_URL check_error "ERROR WHILE DOWNLOADING APACHE ANT" echo "DOWNLOADING APACHE ANT -- DONE"
# EXTRACT THE ANT TAR BALL echo "EXTRACTING APACHE ANT TAR BALL..." tar -xvf ant.tar.gz check_error "ERROR WHILE DOWNLOADING APACHE ANT" # REMOVE THE ANT TAR BALL TO SAVE THE DISK SPACE rm -rf ant.tar.gz # RENAME THE EXTRACTED FOLDER NAME mv `find . -name 'apache-ant*' -type d` apache-ant echo "EXTRACTING APACHE ANT -- DONE"
# SET ENVIRONMENT VARIABLE TO START THE WSO2 ESB
# SETTING PATH PATH=$PATH:/usr/apache-ant/bin
# SETTING JAVA HOME if [ -f /usr/lib/jvm/java/bin/java ]; then export JAVA_HOME=/usr/lib/jvm/java else export JAVA_HOME=/usr fi
# STARTING WSO2 ESB SERVER echo "STARTING WSO2 ESB SERVER..." cd $INSTALL_DIR/wso2esb/bin ./wso2server.sh --start check_error "ERROR WHILE STARTING WSO2 ESB SERVER" echo "STARTING WSO2 ESB SERVER -- DONE" # BUILDING build.xml FILE IN THE CURRENT DIRECTORY echo "BUILDING build.xml FILE IN THE CURRENT DIRECTORY..." ant check_error "ERROR:WHILE BUILDING build.xml FILE IN THE CURRENT DIRECTORY" echo "BUILDING build.xml FILE IN THE CURRENT DIRECTORY -- DONE" # SCRIPT EXECUTION -- END
